Field Detail

start

private CQueue.Node start
The cursor of the circular queue (current position)

Constructor Detail

CQueue

public CQueue()
Constructor: Creates a empty circular queue

Method Detail

empty

public boolean empty()
Determines if the circular queue is empty or not.

Returns:
True if the queue is empty, false in other case

next

public java.lang.Object next()
Advances in the circular one position.

C = a -> b -> c -> d --> a

C.next() => C = b -> c -> d -> a --> b and returns b

Returns:
The object at the circular queue cursor position after advancing one position. Returns null if the queue is empty

advance

public java.lang.Object advance(int n)
Advances in the circular queue n positions.

C = a -> b -> c -> d --> a

C.advance( 2 ) => C = c -> d -> a -> b --> c and returns c

Parameters:
n - The number of positions to advance
Returns:
The object at the circular queue cursor position after advancing n positions. Returns null if the queue is empty

prev

public java.lang.Object prev()
Backs in the circular one position.

C = a -> b -> c -> d --> a

C.prev( ) => C = d -> a -> b -> c --> d and returns d

Returns:
The object at the circular queue cursor position after backing one position. Returns null if the queue is empty

add

public void add(java.lang.Object data)
Adds a new object to the circular queue. The object is added after the current object in the queue. The cursor is not moved.

C = a -> b -> c -> d --> a

C.add( x ) => C = a -> x -> b -> c -> d --> a

Parameters:
data - The object to be added

del

public void del()
Deletes the current object in the circular queue. The new current object is the next to the old current object

C = a -> b -> c -> d --> a

C.del() => C = b -> c -> d --> b

get

public java.lang.Object get()
Gets the current object in the circular queue. If the circular queue is empty return null

C = a -> b -> c -> d --> a

C.get() = a

Returns:
The cursor of the circular queue
